entry.title: BIP 118 and SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT
entry.summary: In an email thread on July 10, 2020, Anthony Towns, a member of the bitcoin-dev community, mentioned a conversation he had with Dr. Christian Decker, also known as "Dr. Bitcoin." The specific topic of their discussion was not disclosed, but it is clear that they were in communication regarding some aspect of the Bitcoin network or technology. Dr. Christian Decker, who goes by the aliases "cdecker" and "Snyke," is a highly respected figure in the Bitcoin space. He holds a PhD in computer science and has made significant contributions to the development of the Lightning Network, a layer-two scaling solution for Bitcoin. Anthony Towns, on the other hand, is a less well-known member of the bitcoin-dev community. According to his LinkedIn profile, he has worked on various open-source software projects and has experience in systems administration and security. Despite the brevity of Towns' email, it provides a glimpse into the way that developers and experts in the Bitcoin space communicate and collaborate with one another. The use of aliases like "Dr. Bitcoin" and "cdecker" underscores the informal nature of these interactions, while the technical jargon and references to specific individuals and projects highlight the depth of expertise that is required to work on Bitcoin-related initiatives.
